business.headline: ITR refund delayed? Here's why the process may take longer this yearTax refunds this year are taking longer than usual, leaving many taxpayers waiting and prompting questions about delays, processing times, and what to expect in the weeks ahead.

Why India's insurance market has become a breeding ground for mis-sellingFrom loans tied to unwanted policies to agents chasing fat commissions, insurance policies that were meant to shield families have instead become a trap for many.

Cryptocurrency a bigger challenge to dollar than BRICS currency, says WEF PresidentSpeaking in an exclusive conversation with India Today TV, Brende said de-dollarisation is unlikely in the near term. He added that cryptocurrency is a bigger challenge to the dollar than a potential BRICS currency.

India powers 18% of global growth, WEF chief sees tariff row with US easing soonIn an exclusive interaction with India Today TV, WEF President Borge Brende described India's rapid expansion as a source of "exported prosperity" to the world. "Just imagine what it means for global prosperity. So, you are exporting prosperity by growing so fast," he said.

A widow's wait, a worker's fight: The human struggle behind PF claimsIn Part 2 of our series on the PF claim crisis, we look at why, for so many Indians, withdrawing their own savings has turned into a struggle, forcing them to fight for money that is rightfully theirs.

Will October bring a market breakout? Earnings, GST price cuts fuel hopeAdani stocks led the rally on Thursday following Sebi's dismissal of Hindenburg Research allegations. Experts say this could mark the start of renewed market optimism.
Sensex, Nifty end lower amid profit booking; Adani Group shares gainThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 387.73 points to close at 82,626.23, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.55 points to settle at 25,327.05.

Explained: Why Intel shares jumped 22% after Nvidia's $5 billion investmentThe Nvidia-Intel deal not only fuels Intel's stock surge but strengthens its next-gen manufacturing and product integration, creating potential market shifts that could challenge competitors like AMD over the coming years.

Waiting for your ITR refund? Here is how to track itAfter filing your ITR, the next big question is, when will the refund come? Instead of guessing, you can quickly check the progress on the official portal.
Sensex tumbles 500 points: Is the stock market rally over?Around midday, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 471.67 points, settling at 82,542.29, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 130.20 points to 25,293.40.

Does the Income Tax Department delay refunds above Rs 50,000?With the ITR deadline now behind us, many taxpayers are anxiously waiting for their refunds. A common doubt is whether larger refunds, such as those above Rs 50,000, take longer to arrive.

New GST rates from September 22: Why you should double-check product MRPsConsumers must remain alert as new GST rates take effect September 22; checking MRPs carefully ensures savings are realised, avoiding overpayment due to old pricing or retailer confusion.

entertainment.headline: Akshay Kumar credits career to stuntmen on The Great Indian Kapil ShowActor Akshay Kumar credited his career's success to stuntmen on 'The Great Indian Kapil Show season 3' finale. He also shared a light-hearted banter with the show's host Kapil Sharma and the rest of the cast as he engaged in playful activities.

Jolly LLB 3 box office day 1: Akshay, Arshad's comedy surpasses Sky Force, Kesari 2Actor Akshay Kumar's 'Jolly LLB 3' opened to a Rs 12.5 crore net collection on day one. The courtroom comedy-drama also features actor Arshad Warsi in a pivotal character.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 27: Abhishek becomes new captain, Baseer-Gaurav clashAbhishek Bajaj is the new captain of 'Bigg Boss 19' house. The actor won the position after a competitive task. In episode 27 of the reality show, a heated argument also erupted between Gaurav Khanna and Baseer Ali.

Ishaan Khatter, Vishal Jethwa call Homebound's India's Oscar entry moment surrealActors Ishaan Khatter and Vishal Jethwa reacted to 'Homebound' getting selected as India's entry for the 98th Academy Awards. The Neeraj Pandey directorial also features actor Janhvi Kapoor in a crucial role.

KBC 17: Contestant Pallavi Niphadkar opens up about undergoing seven miscarriagesPre-primary teacher Pallavi Niphadkar opened up about experiencing seven miscarriages on the latest episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati'. She told host Amitabh Bachchan about her health struggles and shared how adoption brought positivity into her life.

Homebound review: Neeraj Ghaywan's film on caste, faith holds a mirror to societyRelease Date:Fri Sep 26, 2025Homebound review: Director Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' is not just to be watched; it's a heavy, unforgettable cinematic experience that holds up a mirror to a reality you can no longer pretend you didn't know, leaving you with a profound sense of responsibility.

Bollywood's franchise fever: Why filmmakers keep chasing part twos and universesAre you a fan of franchises? Bollywood is hooked on them, banking on them and building universes for box-office wins. Experts from the industry shared why nothing but fresh storytelling can keep the magic alive.

Deepika shares emotional post on 6th collaboration with SRK after exit from Kalki 2Actor Deepika Padukone confirmed her role in Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'King' after leaving the 'Kalki 2989 AD sequel'. This move highlights ongoing industry shifts and creative disagreements in major film projects.

Zubeen Garg's final moments before scuba diving accident surface in viral videoAssamese singer Zubeen Garg died at the age of 52 following a scuba diving accident in Singapore. A video of him wearing a life jacket shortly before the tragedy has since gone viral online.

Kiss review: A cheesy romantic fantasy starring Kavin that tugs at your emotionsRelease Date:Fri Sep 19, 2025Kiss movie review: The Tamil film, written and directed by National award-winning choreographer Sathish Krishnan, stars Kavin and Preeti Israni in the lead. 'Kiss' is a breezy romantic film that is worth watching.

BIFF 2025 Day 3: Kim Da-mi, Dear X screening, and Lee Byung-hun headline BusanThe 30th Busan International Film Festival continued its vibrant run on day 3 with major premieres and star appearances. The event highlighted Netflix hits and exclusive reveals, promising an exciting festival ahead.

Homebound selection for Oscars 2026 a unanimous decision: Film Federation of IndiaThe Film Federation of India president, Firdausul Hasan reflected on 'Homebound' being selected as India's official entry for the 98th Academy Awards. In an exclusive interview with India Today, he stated that the film was unanimously selected by a 14-member jury.

Anurag Kashyap calls out Bollywood's toxicity, criticises AI in cinemaAnurag Kashyap criticised the "toxicity" in Bollywood and said the industry can never be united. He also slammed AI-generated cinema, calling it unethical and warning that actors will only unite when technology begins replacing them.

Homebound co-writer Sumit Roy expresses pride as film gets picked for Oscars 2026Director Neeraj Ghaywan's film 'Homebound' has been selected for the Oscars race. The film's co-writer Sumit Roy reacted to the news expressing pride on representing India globally.

Zubeen Garg, Assam's OG pop balladeer, and the question Gaane ki AaneZubeen Garg wasn't just a singer. He was the voice of Assam, weaving raw emotion into every note that defined generations. From the superhit Maya to intimate folk melodies, Zubeen left an indelible mark. He proved that true music transcends time and controversy.

Karan Johar calls Homebound a labour of love as film heads to Oscars 2026Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound', produced by Karan Johar, has been selected as India's official entry for Oscars 2026 in the Best International Feature category. Calling it a "labour of love," Johar expressed pride, while Ghaywan said representing India on a global stage was both "humbling and a matter of pride."

Rohit Saraf flaunts his abs in Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari song BTS picsRohit Saraf shared behind-the-scenes pictures from the new Holi song 'Panwadi' in his upcoming film 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari'.

Zubeen Garg's sister Jonkey Borthakur died in accident; tragedy shaped musicLife's cruel symmetry has played out for the Borthakur family, after Assam's pop star Zubeen Garg lost his life during a sea outing in Singapore. Twenty-three years ago, Zubeen's sister, Jonkey, met with a road accident that resulted in the death of the 20-year-old singer and actor. Her death in 2002 left young Zubeen devastated and shaped his music, spirit, and musical journey.

Neeraj Ghaywan's Homebound picked as India's official entry to OscarsDirector Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' has been selected as India's official entry for Oscars 2026. The film features Ishaan Khatter, Janhvi Kapoor and Vishal Jethwa in key roles.

general news.headline: No US entry from Sunday unless $100K paid: Trump's disruptive H-1B visa moveUS President Donald Trump signed a proclamation, saying that all H1-B employees, including current visa holders, should pay USD 100,000 (over Rs 88 lakh) every year through their employer or they will be barred from entering the country.

Return before Sunday, Big Tech advises H-1B visa holders as Trump slaps $100K feeIn an internal letter, Amazon asked all employees holding H-1B and H-4 visas to return to the US by September 21, 12 am Eastern Time Zone.

Cyberattack disrupts flights at London, Brussels and other major European airportsThe incident resulted in significant delays and numerous flight cancellations, impacting thousands of passengers across Europe.

Humanity's Weighty Story: From ancient slenderness to a fat crisis triggered by genesHumanity's journey from ancient slender figurines to modern obesity reveals a complex story of genetic legacy, lifestyle shifts, and urbanisation. As the world faces a rising obesity epidemic, understanding this interplay is vital to tackling a growing public health crisis.

Will Saudi step in if there is a war with India? Here's what Pak Minister saidPakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif stated that under a new mutual defence pact with Saudi Arabia, both countries will provide military support if India or any other country launches an attack on either.

Trump's H-1B visa move sparks chaos at airports, flight fares to US soarNew H1B visa rules: H-1B holders in India saw a massive jump in the cost of a direct flight to the US as airlines looked to cash in on the chaos unleashed by US President Donald Trump.

Will Rahul Gandhi's Hydrogen Bomb explode on the Congress?Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's all-out campaign on 'vote chori' and the SIR exercise has raised eyebrows within his own party, with fears it could alienate allies and voters in Bihar. With Gandhi building up the "hydrogen bomb" hype, the Congress faces a dangerous gamble.

Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee is a low blow to IndiaNew H-1B Visa Rules: Just three days ago, Donald Trump wished PM Modi on his birthday, signalling a thaw in ties. Two days later, he revoked the sanctions' waiver for Chabahar Port and imposed a $100,000 fee for H-1B visas. Is Trump playing the classic 'good cop, bad cop' negotiation strategy with India?
The 80% gap: Why most Indians are underinsured and why it's time to actThe solution lies in choosing a comprehensive life cover that reflects modern realities.

University of Bath School of Management: Where Careers Begin With ConfidenceWith students from over 160 countries and a strong alumni network spanning 130 nations, the School creates a community that feels global in reach yet personal in experience.

Being bright student no ground to cancel case: Court on Op Sindoor offensive postThe Bombay High Court refused to quash an FIR against a Pune student for an objectionable Op Sindoor post, stating that being a "bright student" is no ground for relief.

Why Trump's H-1B crackdown could spark India's talent renaissanceSeveral Indians have lashed out at US President Donald Trump's executive order to impose a USD 100,000 (over Rs 88 lakh) annual fee on H-1B visas, saying the move will "kill" the American economy and boost the Indian economy.

Pakistan says its nukes are available for Saudi Arabia under new defence pactPakistan's nuclear capabilities could be extended to Saudi Arabia under a new defence pact, Defence Minister Khawaja Asif said, in the first clear signal that Islamabad has placed Riyadh under its nuclear umbrella.

Big blow for India? How Trump's killing of Chabahar port waiver will hit DelhiThe US move to end the sanctions waiver given to India for Iran's Chabahar port threatens New Delhi's $500-million investment and its bid to reach Afghanistan and Central Asia, bypassing Pakistan. Donald Trump's decision jeopardises India's first overseas port project and undermines the Chabahar port, the strategic counter to Pakistan's Gwadar port of China.
Minutes to disaster: The science and struggle of predicting cloudburstsThe uncertainty of cloudbursts needs better data, multichannel alerts, and local engagement to reduce the havoc they cause.

Phone off, sleep: Suryakumar's hilarious response to handling IND vs PAK noiseSuryakumar Yadav had the reporters in splits as he gave a hilarious response to the question of handling the noise ahead of an India vs Pakistan game. Doctor reveals the hidden risk behind sudden spike in diabetes and heart disease in kidsChildhood obesity is quietly fuelling a surge in diabetes and heart disease. Experts warn that poor diet, junk food, and inactivity are creating a silent epidemic that could burden India with chronic illness for generations.

sports.headline: From Rurki to Liverpool glory: Minakshi on her journey to be World ChampionAfter creating history by winning gold in the 48kg category at the 2025 World Boxing Championships in Liverpool, Minakshi Hooda opens up on her struggles, support from her village and a message to young athletes in the country.

India remains unbeaten in the Asia Cup, while Pakistan struggles with form and consistency, making the Super 4 clash a high-stakes, India-favoured encounter.

The Harmanpreet Kaur-led side will be eyeing a historic first series win over the Aussies to cap off their preparations for the World Cup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
